snippet: An inspection of the blood testing company found that its tiny blood collection tubes had not been cleared by regulators. It was also found to be lax on following up on consumer complaints.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration releases two reports finding faults with facilities operated by medical testing company Theranos, particularly with blood collection tube that agency says is unapproved medical device; reports add to questions that have cropped up about company's testing technology and degree to which technology it uses is its own.
lead_paragraph: An inspection of the blood testing company found that its tiny blood collection tubes had not been cleared by regulators. It was also found to be lax on following up on consumer complaints.

headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Reports Add to Pressure on Medical Test Company
headline.main: F.D.A. Cites Unapproved Device in Theranos Review, and Faults Handling of Complaints
